name: rabbit
description: Did you know that rabbits can turn their ears to detect predators from different directions?

name: fox
description: Did you know that foxes use Earth's magnetic field to hunt by jumping precisely on prey even under snow?

name: eagle
description: Did you know that eagles have eyesight up to 8 times stronger than humans, spotting prey from miles away?

name: owl
description: Did you know that owls can rotate their heads almost 270 degrees?

name: wolf
description: Did you know that wolves have large territories that can range up to 1,000 square miles?

name: bear
description: Did you know that bears can run up to 40 miles per hour despite their large size?

name: deer
description: Did you know that deer can jump as high as 10 feet in the air to escape predators?

name: snake
description: Did you know that snakes use their tongues to 'smell' the air and track prey?

name: frog
description: Did you know that frogs absorb water through their skin, so they donâ€™t need to drink?

name: mouse
description: Did you know that mice can communicate using ultrasonic sounds that humans can't hear?

name: lion
description: Did you know that a lion's roar can be heard from as far as 5 miles away?

name: elephant
description: Did you know that elephants can 'hear' with their feet by detecting vibrations from long distances?

name: tiger
description: Did you know that tigers have unique stripes, just like human fingerprints?

name: zebra
description: Did you know that no two zebras have the same stripe pattern?

name: hyena
description: Did you know that hyenas have some of the strongest jaws in the animal kingdom, capable of crushing bones?

name: buffalo
description: Did you know that buffalos can weigh up to 2,000 pounds but can still run up to 35 mph?

name: cheetah
description: Did you know that cheetahs are the fastest land animals, reaching speeds of up to 70 mph?

name: crocodile
description: Did you know that crocodiles can hold their breath underwater for up to an hour?

name: hippopotamus
description: Did you know that hippos are considered one of the most dangerous animals in Africa due to their aggressive nature?

name: giraffe
description: Did you know that a giraffe's tongue is about 20 inches long and helps it grab leaves?

name: kangaroo
description: Did you know that kangaroos can leap over 30 feet in a single bound?

name: dingo
description: Did you know that dingoes are Australia's largest terrestrial predator?

name: penguin
description: Did you know that penguins can dive as deep as 500 meters in search of food?

name: leopard seal
description: Did you know that leopard seals can grow up to 12 feet long, making them one of the Antarctic's top predators?

name: orca
description: Did you know that orcas are also known as 'killer whales' but are actually the largest species of dolphin?

name: shark
description: Did you know that sharks have existed for over 400 million years, longer than dinosaurs?

name: seal
description: Did you know that seals can sleep underwater and come up for air every few minutes?

name: octopus
description: Did you know that octopuses have three hearts and blue blood?

name: salmon
description: Did you know that salmon return to the exact river where they were born to spawn?

name: otter
description: Did you know that sea otters hold hands when they sleep to avoid drifting apart?

name: sparrow
description: Did you know that sparrows have been associated with humans for over 10,000 years?

name: hawk
description: Did you know that hawks have incredible eyesight, able to spot prey from 100 feet in the air?

name: caterpillar
description: Did you know that caterpillars can grow up to 1000 times their size in just a few weeks?

name: bat
description: Did you know that bats are the only mammals capable of true flight?

name: rat
description: Did you know that rats can swim for hours and can even tread water for up to three days?

name: chicken
description: Did you know that chickens are the closest living relative to the Tyrannosaurus rex?

name: peacock
description: Did you know that peacocks can make over 11 different sounds to communicate?

name: swan
description: Did you know that swans are known to mate for life, often staying with the same partner forever?

name: dog
description: Did you know that dogs can recognize more than 100 words and gestures?

name: cat
description: Did you know that domestic cats can run up to 30 miles per hour?

name: panda
description: Did you know that pandas spend up to 16 hours a day eating bamboo?

name: monkey
description: Did you know that monkeys can understand numbers and use tools?
